intro: Ouratea erythrocalyx, commonly known as the red calyx ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic plants like cinnamon and avocado. The plant is characterized by its striking red calyx that persists on the fruit, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and often have a strong aromatic scent. It typically grows as an understory tree in humid, shaded forests, thriving in warm and moist conditions.
